$interpreted: Eidatyr: Die, you foul things, die!
Hugo: The strong should not threaten the weak.
Hugo: —Evil must be punished!
Hugo: (So it's you, Fifth Parhelion...)
Hugo: (At last, is it about to begin...? The final road, the way back...)
Nolva: Ah! We saw a bunch of monsters gathering here, and... Huh?! Are you alright?
Eidatyr: Tsk... Who the hell are you...
Nolva: Wait, uh, we're not bad people, we...
Hugo: No, from her perspective, we could be very bad indeed. Lying is evil, Nolva Carpenter.
Nolva: Oh... Please, Hugo, just keep quiet for a moment.
Eidatyr: What... are you two... talking... about...
Nolva: She's fainted...! But why...?! Is there somebody else...
Hugo: They're under the influence of the ritual. Their life forces are being drained. If we don't put a stop to it, everybody will soon be dead from exhaustion.
Nolva: There're more monsters coming! What should we do...
Hugo: Listen.
Nolva: Eh?
Hugo: This is where it all began—the source capable of resolving all catastrophes.
Hugo: I've taken you this far, but I can take you no further. There's only one person who can show you the way now.
Nolva: I don't understand...
Hugo: Listen carefully. I can't hear it, but you can.
Hugo: —The Decree of the Dragon.
Nolva: What...?!
Nolva: That voice...!
: In—my—presence—residing.
Hugo: ...The monsters... have returned to Soul Energy.
Nolva: The light... It's gathering together...!
Hugo: Sdorica...
Gretta: (Such a familiar feeling... Sdorica! Is that you?)
Gretta: (Thank you... Thank you!)
Gretta: This time... We've finally done it...
Nolva: Ahh! The volcano...
Gretta: ...You're still breathing...
Gretta: Excellent... You've both survived...
Nolva: It's... a boat...?
Hugo: An ark. An ark that'll take us back to the Mechanical Territory.
Hugo: —To my homeland.
Nolva: Mechanical Territory? But how'll we get there...
Nolva: ......
Nolva: By following... the aurora...?
Theodore: Ugh...
Mercenary: You're awake, Lord Theodore.
Theodore: How long was I unconscious for...
Mercenary: It's been a while. We almost lost you!
Theodore: ...And the aurora? How long has it been here for?
Mercenary: It... It just appeared all of a sudden, just a moment ago.
Mercenary: Should we go take a look? It might have something to do with the sect you've been investigating...
Theodore: (Originally I'd hoped to take the twins back to the Kingdom of the Sun and shelter them there. Then we'd have the sect right where we wanted them...)
Theodore: (That's why we pretended to cooperate with the Twelve Nobles in the first place... What a shame. We'll have to think of another way...)
Theodore: (...But whatever means we come up with, the biggest challenge of all will be convincing Angelia to listen to me...)
Theodore: ...The ship for Atlas should be here already, is that right?
Mercenary: Yes, Sir, it has arrived.
Theodore: Take me to it.
Mercenary: Huh? But what about here...?
Theodore: There's nothing more to be done here. It's not worth taking any more risks. I should go back.
Mercenary: Yes, Sir!
Theodore: The north is fated for destruction, it cannot escape its destiny...

Model.Text: Die, you foul things, die!

In—my—presence—residing.
...The monsters... have returned to Soul Energy.
The light... It's gathering together...!

It... It just appeared all of a sudden, just a moment ago.
Should we go take a look? It might have something to do with the sect you've been investigating...
(Originally I'd hoped to take the twins back to the Kingdom of the Sun and shelter them there. Then we'd have the sect right where we wanted them...)
(That's why we pretended to cooperate with the Twelve Nobles in the first place... What a shame. We'll have to think of another way...)
(...But whatever means we come up with, the biggest challenge of all will be convincing Angelia to listen to me...)
...The ship for Atlas should be here already, is that right?
Yes, Sir, it has arrived.
Take me to it.
Huh? But what about here...?
There's nothing more to be done here. It's not worth taking any more risks. I should go back.
Yes, Sir!
The north is fated for destruction, it cannot escape its destiny...
